column4: If I've got a USB external drive that Ubuntu tells me it cannot mount, is it toast?
or you can install ntfsprogs and fix it from ubuntu
are you plugging into a usb hub or straight into a usb port on the computer?
two USB jacks into the computer
hrmm... got a different usb cord to try with?
that would require a different external enclosure. I'm not certain I have anymore of those around
o.O oh my... i'm used to the kind where the usb cable is detachable
do you have another system you could test it on?
errors seem about the same in Fedora Core 3 and Windows completely fails to recognize it past "Your device is ready to use"
what about the internal connection to the drive itself? tried reseating the cable?

i have also discovered that blank portions of a wall make a good place to insert nails in order to hang the carcasses of dead hard drives on, with their top plates removed to expose the disks themselves in a shiny manner :)
I like using them as spinner art. 7200rpms make some might pretty pictures
take off the top plate, provide power so the drives start spinning and color away with your favorite dry erase markers
careful of your fingers though, it'll do quite a bit of damage if they get caught too close to the business end of that platter
oh... i was thinking more along the lines of wearing skin and face protection while letting paint drip from a brush
I did not even think of that
brilliant! I'm going home to decorate the house
